ovdesc.p: This file contains definitions of all types of Swap contracts allowed on the system.
o IRS Interest Rate Swap o CIRS Currency Rate Swap.
It also holds the following details with regard to the Swap type :
o Product Category code. o Forward rate method.

desc.p: Reserved for future use.

t.desc:
This field specifies whether the
SWAP contracts using this swap type are to be processed at the start of day or at the end of day.
Input Yes to make the swap mature or take value during the start of day procedure (
SW.START.OF.DAY) on the morning of the maturity or value date, instead of being processed in the end of day procedure (
SW.END.OF.DAY) after the system has been closed down on the maturity or value date.
Limit exposures for the swap are also updated during the start of day procedure (
SYSTEM.LIMIT.SOD) on the morning of the maturity or value date, instead of being updated in the end of day procedure (
SYSTEM.LIMIT.EOD) after the system has been closed down on the maturity or value date.
All accounting entries, payments, payment messages and limit updates for deals maturing or taking value are raised during the start of day procedure.
There is a
SOD.MAT field on
SWAP. If it is left blank, the value of
SWAP.TYPE
SOD.MAT is used. If
SWAP
SOD.MAT is set, it overrides
SWAP.TYPE
SOD.MAT.
Validation Rules:
Y or N (default = N)

This field details whether the SWAP contracts using this swap type are to be treated as an ON balance sheet instrument or an OFF balance sheet instrument. This value is defaulted into the SWAP contract.
When this field contains the value OFF the contracts will undergo the currency revaluation processing. Each night each leg of the contract id revalued against the local currency if
1) The leg is not notional (ie the NOTIONAL field on the SWAP.BALANCES file is set to NO).
2) The currency of the leg is not the local currency.
And any difference between this value and the value as of last night is posted as unreleasied profit and loss to the category specified on the SWAP.PARAMETER record.
When this field contains the value of ON the contracts will not be revalued.
Input must either be ON or OFF. Mandatory Input.

t.desc:
This field specifies whether the
SWAP contracts using this swap type default to be flexible currency swaps.
Input Yes to make the swap a flexible currency swap. It may have PX without RX and vice versa, early maturity, and notional or real principal changes during the life of the deal.
Note that this field only provides the default. You can edit
FLEX.PRIN.PAYMENT on the
SWAP deal.
Validation Rules:
Yes or No (default = No)
